section.text: *NOTE: This section includes amendments by emergency legislation that will expire on February 22, 2026. To view the text of this section after the expiration of all emergency and temporary legislation, click this link: Permanent Version.*
section.heading: Board of Pharmacy Fund.

para.text: There is established as a special fund the Board of Pharmacy Fund ("Fund"), which shall be administered by the Department of Health in accordance with subsection (c) of this section.
All licensing fees, civil fines, and interest earned relating to the practice of pharmaceutical detailing shall be deposited in the Fund.
For the purposes of this subsection, the term "practice of pharmaceutical detailing" shall have the same meaning as provided in § 3-1201.02(10A).
Money in the Fund shall be used for the administration of the Board of Pharmacy.

Any money remaining available in the Fund at the end of a fiscal year, as determined by the Chief Financial Officer in the fiscal year-end close, shall be transferred to the unassigned fund balance of the General Fund of the District of Columbia as part of the fiscal year-end close.

annotations.annotation: Delegation of Authority pursuant to D.C. Law 17-131, the SafeRX Amendment Act of 2008, see Mayor’s Order 2008-83, June 11, 2008 ( 55 DCR 9360).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 7080 of Fiscal Year 2026 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-146, Sept. 3, 2025, 72 DCR 9623).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 7080 of Fiscal Year 2026 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-210, Nov. 24, 2025, 0 DCR 0).
